主流即影即有相機

ＰＯＬＡＲＯＩＤ

600系，用６００菲林，iso640
例如：
古董機
Sun 600 (泛焦)


Autofocus 660 (聲納對焦)



新機

(留意原本第一代One Step盒型機屬於SX-70系)

SX-70系，用SX-70菲林，iso160
例如：
古董機 - SX-70

古董機 - SX-70 Sonar Onestep 配腳架加閃光燈
"招財貓"


古董機 - SX-70 MODEL 3 (留意 MODEL 3 係估焦機)



Spectra系，用Spectra菲林，長方形相，iso600/640
例如：
古董機 - Spectra (Sonar Focusing)


古董機 - Spectra 個 Fd Minolta Instant Pro



Spectra系，SLR，用Spectra菲林，長方形相，iso600/640
例如：
古董機 - Marco 5 SLR (估唔到係單鏡吧？)


更舊嘅有風琴機 (台灣稱為蛇腹機)
例如：
古董機 - Polaroid Land 100



ＦＵＪＩ

Instax Square
SQ10

SQ6


Instax Wide 300


Instax Mini



當然，仲有好多唔同款既機，

MINT TL70


LOMOGRAPHY Series


名牌子有Leica，異軍突起有老母(Lomography)，
香港自家出品有MINT，
仲有一些係可以加一個Back令到架相機變成即影即有…等等。


新款四方老母(Lomography)
借巴打相一用





仲有改機巴打各種創意而且影到好好效果嘅相機。
歡迎大家挑機。

當然仲有好多唔同牌子相機。



即影即有菲林

Fujifilm



Polaroid Originals®


Fuji已停產 Packfilm (借巴打相一用)



菲林我自己通常係指"自己沖曬"果種Film，
比較廉價嘅一種係"用printer印既即影即有"，
白色相紙比菲林平 香港流行過一排。

即影即有相紙需要外在printer印相上去，
即影即有菲林/底片剛係自己沖曬。

Print相嘅我諗就唔講了，超過十年前，
Canon都已經出過即影即印數碼相。
Impossible"影塔"亦係用電話影就可以即印數碼相。
出面有post討論嘞。

【用Leica相機拍即影即有不是夢．Instant Magny 35】

新成立的設計工作室NINM Lab早前於網上發佈一系列預告片段，表示將於本周二晚上10時Kickstarter上發佈攝影相關產品。而在今日率先揭曉產品真面目，名為Instant Magny 35的即影即有機背，讓五大相機品牌Leica、Nikon、Canon、Pentax、Olympus超過35個型號的135菲林相機 ，在毋須任何改裝下，也能使用Fujifilm Instax Square拍攝即影即有照片，更可使用原系統內所有鏡頭。

計劃將於本周二（6月12日）晚上十時於Kickstarter登場，最優惠售價由 HKD778起（名額有限）。詳情可留意NINM Lab網站了解更多消息：www.ninmlab.com

台灣貴，台灣代理實驗攝個價都貴過香港，摺機一般比香港黑店要再貴少少，壞/零件機價大約係香港好機肥花價。
而且台灣二手私放，你需要有台灣付款方法或面交，例如金融卡（即香港saving acct嘅咭）或者係台灣國內銀行發行嘅信用咭付款。國外銀行戶口大都不接受。

我都有部機係台灣二手私放，係朋友先代付。我冇台灣銀行戶口。

replies.msg:
如果你當部機值三千，其他錢係做左善事就ok。

因為mint 已經係one and the only one。

唔講幾貴，我覺得部機最煩係出兩條菲林roller。個兩碌鐵同兩條彈弓係你要拆過instax wide先知幾咁西煩，同埋做金屬機身又會貴一個dup。

當然要平的話，你可以自己改110a,b 做intax wide(最簡單solution)，我自己砌110a +instax wide 100 埋單料錢三千左右，不過就重手，重過部哈仔。

picture quality呢點都要睇佢出大貨再講。一陣唔對光軸，RF 走焦就大鑊。

DOC'S INSTANT ADVENTURE CONTINUES


Jul 11, 2018



Dear fellow packfilm adventure travelers,

I am writing this update more than 2 years after I started this adventure on March 11th of 2016. As you know I was not really able to present you some promising progress so far, and the last update has been posted more than 6 months ago. For many of you it might have seemed like this has come to an end. Today I am happy to report that quite the contrary is true, as with SUPERSENSE being a magnet for crazy analog tinkerers, inventors, makers, believers and dreamers, I could recruit a really breathtakingly powerful league of SUPERHEROS over the last few months, capable and ready to fight for and develop truly realistic options for the future of packfilm.

I hope and I know and I feel that the packfilm community's heart out there is still beating, united by love and passion for this endangered medium. Together we are strong and unstoppable, stubborn as a rock and I cordially invite you to re-start this adventure with me.

From tomorrow on I will proudly introduce my new league of PACKFILM SUPERHEROES as well as our super smart strategy that we developed over the last months, as we know that this is most probably our very last chance.

So please undust your packfilm cameras, stay tuned and delight us with your trust and support one more time to together prepare for the ultimate battle for our beloved packfilm

Yours truly excited,

Florian 'Doc' Kaps

Tags: SAVEPACKFILM
Florian Kaps

FUNDING OUR DREAM

Jul 13, 2018

Dear all,


no matter how much superpower and passion you have, without solid funding no dreams and visions can become true. As we are not Bruce Wayne and our financial resources are in contrast to our dreams strictly limited, we decided on a 2 layer crowd funding process to provide the liquidity needed for this adventure.

A. A Packfilm Project Supporter Shop presenting a selection of carefully collected packfilm treasures of the glory past in order to finance the first steps of development of a glory packfilm future

B. A big Save Packfilm Kickstarter Campaign launching on September 20, 8pm local Vienna time

This is the moment to also proudly introduce our SUPERHERO NR. 2:
Mr. Uwe Schneider!!



This distinguished German gentleman is the most trustworthy and powerful, passionate, visionary film dealer the world has ever seen. Since many years Uwe supported even our wildest dreams, being among the very first to invest my so far most impossible project: the purchase of the last Polaroid factory in 2008.

Now, 10 years later Uwe agreed to dedicate his IMPRESSIVE ULTIMATE PACKFILM STOCK ARCHIVE, EXCLUSIVELY to our brand new SAVE PACKFILM SUPPORTER SHOP.

From NOW ON you can purchase perfectly stored packfilms from the last production runs in 2017 for a special price below the currently exploding market price WITH THE CONFIDENCE that 10,- EUR of each film pack sold DIRECTLY goes into the development of the prototypes needed in order to qualify for a professional Kickstarter campaign.

THANK YOU UWE!!!
And thank you all for your support,

Florian 'Doc' Kaps

https://www.kamerastelle.de/2017/08/08/how-to-change-the-leather-of-your-polaroid-sx70-camera-diy/

How does this work? We will lead you through the steps:



First of all you need the right equipment:

Hair dryer
Spatula
White spirit (or Alcohol 100%)
Q-Tips
Micro-fiber cloth
A custom-fitted new leather skin with the color of your choice


WARNING! Do not use acetone as it can damage the camera.



1. Heat the old leather on the camera with the hair dryer to dissolve the old glue.

2. If the leather does not come off easy, carefully use the spatula to remove the leather.

3. Heat the leather again if needed.

4. After the leather was removed, clean the glue residues with the micro-fabric cloth, the Q-tips and white spirit.



Now you can attach the new leather to your SX 70 Camera



1. Remove the plastic film from the doublesided adhesive film. Now it sounds a little disgusting, but if you use spit and rub it to all of the adhesive film you can move it into the right position easily.

I know this sounds weird, but this is really the best way how you can attach leather with doublesided adhesive film to your camera.

Does not work with water!



2. Bring the leather into the right position and press it to the camera. Remove all air bubbles (tip: use a card to smooth it).

replies.msg:
其實，睇你咩皮就得。

基本上都用：白電油，風筒，細鐵尺，好多心機。

啡皮就拆完有機會重新裝返（例如維修就會咁做），其他皮都不可逆轉，拆出來就會碎哂。

要留意嘅係：除左電鍍機身不受白電油影響之外，白電油會令其他膠面機身變得啞光。（原本機身其實有輕微“令“面，估計係一層coating而非抛光）

第一次落左訂等左成年都無晒消息，之後又集資唔到。

雷聲大雨點小

終於的起心肺去咗中上環燒相紙。

100c Packfilm最大問題，依然係影完點處理張相紙同底片，痴立立真係好Q煩呀　

另外以前冬天用開，所以應該耐得濟先撕佢出嚟，同埋五點幾又無乜陽光，所以啲色唔太出　

今日蘇豪區30幾度，跟佢應該60幾秒就撕。但右邊成3分鐘先撕，左邊直島都成分半鐘先撕　

咁熱應該要60秒左右就好撕先啱　

之後影咗大半盒SQ，其實較啱焦距範圍（主要用無限遠多），一般效果都唔錯嘅，係隧道入面under太多（但天花板嘅燈又曝得還好）　

其實我見幾多着旗袍幾好睇（應該喺嫣裳記租跟住一日遊影相咁），但毒撚唔敢影

Review: MiNT InstantKon RF70 (Fujifilm Instax Wide and Manual Controls)

12. Jun. 2018


Pros

Manual controls

Rangefinder focusing

Aperture priority is an option

Folds down into a compact camera

Built in flash for the folks who are into that sort of stuff

Lens is pretty sharp when stopped down

Beautiful bokeh


Cons

Really odd type of audio jack for flash syncing. I genuinely wish that it were either a PC sync port or a standard 3.5mm

Rangefinder focusing screen isn’t coupled to the framing screen and that can throw off compositions at times when taking parallax correction into account

Lomography’s glass lenses are much sharper

The bellows is a bit concerning for the long term durability of the product

Be careful when collapsing the camera system: you need to press the button under the lens, focus the lens out to infinity, and then collapse it into the camera body

The instructions should really be on top of the camera and people should read them before taking it out of the box


Flash同Bellow等都可以接受，係鏡頭出問題，繼續睇埋落去先…
Lomo 都 sharp 過佢！？

quote.msg: Lomo 都 sharp 過佢！？

replies.msg:
With the MiNT InstantKon RF70, I really like the bokeh. It’s a cross between hazy and creamy but, no matter what, it looks beautiful. It’s bound to help you create some gorgeous portraits. Of course, the best bokeh is when you shoot wide open. You should fully understand that when you do this, you’re going to lose sharpness with the lens. The image above was shot at f6.7. But compared to the image below of me at f5.6, you’ll see how soft the lens is.



…

If you want the best of bokeh and sharpness, you’re going to want to shoot at f8. It won’t be the sharpest, and the bokeh won’t be the best of what’s available but that’s how you’ll get balance.





…

I’d love to see what a camera with the final coatings on the lens look like, that could indeed change things.
